name: Belladona
details:
Belladona acts upon every part of the nervous system, producing active congestion, furious excitement, perverted special senses, twitching, convulsion and pain.
It has a marked action on vascular system, skin and glands. Belladona always is associated with hot, red skin, flushed face, glaring eyes, throbbing carotids, excited mental state, hyperaesthesia of all senses, delirium, restless sleep, convulsive movements,
dryness of mouth and throat with aversion to wate, neuralgic pains that come and go suddenly.
Heat, redness, throbbing and burning. Great children's remedy. Epileptic spasms followed by nausea and vomiting. Scarlet fever. Exophthalmic goitre. Corresponds to the symptoms of air-sickness in aviators. Give as preventive.
No thirst, anxiety or feat. Belladona stands for violence of attack and suddenness of onset. Belladona for extreme thyroid toxaemia.
dosage: First to thirtieth potency and higher. Must be repeated frequently in acute diseases.

Heart: Violent palpitation, reverberating in head, with labored breathing.
Skin: Alternate redness and paleness of the skin.
Dry and hot; swollen, sensitive; burns scarlet, smooth.
Head: Headache worse on right side and when lying down; ill effects, colds etc; from having hair cut.
Boring of head into pillow; drawn backward and rolls from side to side.
Much throbbing and heat.
Sudden outcries.
Constant moaning.
Vertigo, with falling to left side or backwards.
Pain worse with light, noise, jar, lying down and in afternoon; better by pressure and semi erect posture.
Hair splits; is dry and comes out.
Palpitation reverberating in head and labored breathing.
Pain; fullness, especially in forehead, also occiput and temples.
Sensitive to least contact.
Headache from suppressed catarrhal flow.
Stool: Stinging pain in rectum; spasmodic stricture.
Thin, green, dysenteric; in lumps like chalk.
Ears: Child cries out in sleep; throbbing and beating pain deep in ear, synchronous with heartbeat.
Autophony - hearing one's voice in ear.
Tearing pain in middle and external ear.
Acute and sub-acute conditions of Eustachian tube.
Abdomen: Exterme sensitiveness to touch, bed-clothes, etc.
Cutting pain across; Stitches in left side of abdomen, when coughing, sneezing or touching it.
Transverse colon protrudes like a pad.
Pain as if clutched by hand; Worse on jar, pressure.
Mind: He is acutely alive and crazed by a flood of subjective visual impressions and fantastic illusions.
While the ratina is insensible to actual objects, a host of visual hallucinations throng about him and come to him from within.
Delirium; frightful images; furious; rages, bites, strikes; desire to escape.
Patient lives in a world of his own, engrossed by spectres and visions and oblivious to surrounding realities.
Back: Lumbargo, with pain in hips and thighs.
Pressure on dorsal region most painful.
Pain in nape, as if it would break.
Fever: A high feverish state with comparative absense of toxaemia.
Extremeties: Joints swollen, red, shining, with red streaks radiating.
Respiratory: Larynx very painful; feels as if a foreign body were in it, with cough.
Cough with pain in left hip.
Barking cough, whooping cough, with pain in stomach before attack, with expectoration of blood.
Tickling, short, dry cough; worse at night.
Drying in nose, fauces, larynx and trachea.
Modalities: Worse: touch, jar, noise, draught, after noon, lying down.
Urine: Urine scanty, with tenesmus; dark and turbid, loaded with phosphates.
Hematuria where pathological condition can be found.
Sensation in bladder as of a worm.
Sleep: Restless, crying out, gritting of teeth.
Kept awake by pulsation of blood-vessels.
Starting when closing the eyes or during sleep.
Nose: Bleeding of nose, with red face.
Throat: Dry, as if glazed; angry-looking congestion.
Tonsils enlarged; throat feels constricted; difficult deglutition; Worse with liquids.
Face: Facial neuralgia with twitching muscles and flushed face.
Red, bluish-red, hot, swollen, shining; convulsive motion of muscles of face.
Female: Menses increased; bright red, too early, too profuse.
Tumors of breast, pain worse when lying down.
Mastitis pain, throbbing, redness, streaks radiate from nipple.
Breasts feel heavy; are hard and red.
Badly smelling hemorrhages, hot gushes of blood.
Menses and lochia very offensive and hot.
Labor pains come and go suddenly.
Sensitive forcing downwards, as if all the viscera would protrude at genitals.
Cutting pain from hip to hip.
Eyes: Throbbing deep in eyes on lying down.
Sensation as if eyes were half closed.
Eyes feel swollen and protruding, staring, brilliant; conjuctiva red; dry, burn; photophobia; shootin in eyes.
